page.title: 01KILBURN(DERBY)AREA 0436 0345
page.content: { Ours is a mixture of farmland, housing, together with spoil_heaps from earlier coal_mining operations and criss_crossed by roads. The chief of these roads is a fairly new dual carriageway the oldest being part of the Roman road known as Ryknield Road. The land is naturally undulating, the spoil_heaps and cuttings and embankments reinforcing this aspect of the area's appearence, whilst the North_South ridge on the west side of the area separates it from the Derwent Vally and the town of Belper(pop. 17000). Most housing development is along the lines of the chief roads, Kilburn being the largest of the villages in the area, others being Denby, Openwoodgate, most of Holbrook and part of Horsley Woodhouse.
